Reference for the snuxt command-line interface.

## Commands

### `init`

Initialize snuxt in your project.

```bash
npx snuxt init
```

Creates a `snuxt.json` configuration file and sets up the output directory structure.

### `add`

Add one or more components to your project.

```bash
npx snuxt add <component...>
```

Examples:

```bash
npx snuxt add button
npx snuxt add card input textarea
npx snuxt add dialog --framework react
```

The CLI automatically resolves internal dependencies. For example, `npx snuxt add dialog` also copies `button` since Dialog depends on it.

## Component Registry

| Component | Type | Dependencies |
|-----------|------|--------------|
| `button` | CSS-only |  |
| `badge` | CSS-only |  |
| `card` | CSS-only |  |
| `input` | CSS-only |  |
| `textarea` | CSS-only |  |
| `avatar` | CSS-only |  |
| `separator` | CSS-only |  |
| `skeleton` | CSS-only |  |
| `progress` | CSS-only |  |
| `loader` | CSS-only |  |
| `chips` | CSS-only |  |
| `counter` | CSS-only |  |
| `alert` | CSS-only |  |
| `password-input` | CSS-only | `input` |
| `dialog` | Interactive | `button` |
| `tabs` | Interactive |  |
| `accordion` | Interactive |  |
| `select` | Interactive |  |
| `tooltip` | Interactive |  |
| `popover` | Interactive |  |
| `toast` | Interactive |  |
| `drawer` | Interactive |  |
| `dropdown-menu` | Interactive |  |
| `switch` | Interactive |  |

**CSS-only** components ship just CSS + a thin React/Angular wrapper.
**Interactive** components include core logic (TypeScript) that handles state, keyboard navigation, and ARIA attributes.
Customize colors, switch themes, and use design tokens.
Get up and running with snuxt in minutes.

## Prerequisites

- **Node.js** 20+
- **pnpm**, **npm**, or **yarn**
- **Tailwind CSS v4** configured in your project

## Quick Start

### 1. Initialize snuxt in your project

```bash
npx snuxt init
```

This creates a `snuxt.json` config file and sets up the required directory structure.

### 2. Add components

```bash
npx snuxt add button
npx snuxt add card input dialog
```

Components are copied directly into your project  you own the source code.

### 3. Import the CSS

In your main CSS file, import the base tokens and component styles:

```css
@import 'tailwindcss';
@import './snuxt/css/base.css';
@import './snuxt/css/components/button.css';
@import './snuxt/css/components/card.css';
```

### 4. Use in your code

```tsx
import { Button } from './snuxt/react/button'

function App() {
  return <Button variant="primary">Click me</Button>
}
```

## What gets copied?

When you run `npx snuxt add button`, the CLI copies:

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `css/components/button.css` | Tailwind v4 styles |
| `react/button.tsx` | React component |
| `core/button.ts` | Core logic (interactive components only) |

## React

### 1. Set up Tailwind CSS v4

```bash
npm install tailwindcss @tailwindcss/vite
```

In your Vite config:

```js
import tailwindcss from '@tailwindcss/vite'

export default {
  plugins: [tailwindcss()],
}
```

### 2. Initialize snuxt

```bash
npx snuxt init
```

### 3. Add components

```bash
npx snuxt add button card dialog
```

### 4. Import CSS

In your main CSS file:

```css
@import 'tailwindcss';
@import './snuxt/css/base.css';
@import './snuxt/css/components/button.css';
@import './snuxt/css/components/card.css';
@import './snuxt/css/components/dialog.css';
```

### 5. Use components

```tsx
import { Button } from './snuxt/react/button'
import { Dialog, DialogHeader, DialogTitle } from './snuxt/react/dialog'
```

## Angular

### 1. Set up Tailwind CSS v4

```bash
npm install tailwindcss
```

Add to your `angular.json` styles array:

```json
"styles": ["src/styles.css"]
```

### 2. Initialize and add components

```bash
npx snuxt init --framework angular
npx snuxt add button card
```

### 3. Use standalone components

```typescript
import { ButtonComponent } from './snuxt/angular/button.component'

@Component({
  standalone: true,
  imports: [ButtonComponent],
  template: `<snx-button variant="primary">Click</snx-button>`,
})
export class AppComponent {}
```

## Manual Installation

If you prefer not to use the CLI, you can copy files directly from the [snuxt repository](https://github.com/thepsygeek/snuxt):

1. Copy `packages/css/base.css` to your project
2. Copy the component CSS from `packages/css/components/`
3. Copy the React/Angular component from `packages/react/src/` or `packages/angular/src/`
4. For interactive components, also copy the core logic from `packages/core/src/`

import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components'

A composable prompt input for AI chat interfaces. Includes a resizable textarea, action buttons slot, character count, and file attachment pills.

## Preview

<Tabs>
  <TabItem label="Preview">
    <ComponentPreview>
      <PromptInputDemo client:load />
    </ComponentPreview>
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="React">
    ```tsx
    import { useState } from 'react'
    import {
      PromptInput, PromptInputTextarea, PromptInputFooter,
      PromptInputActions, PromptInputCharCount,
      PromptInputAttachments, PromptInputAttachment, Button,
    } from '@snuxt-ui/react'

    export function PromptInputDemo() {
      const [value, setValue] = useState('')

      return (
        <PromptInput>
          <PromptInputAttachments>
            <PromptInputAttachment onRemove={() => {}}>report.pdf</PromptInputAttachment>
          </PromptInputAttachments>
          <PromptInputTextarea
            placeholder="Ask me anything..."
            value={value}
            onChange={(e) => setValue(e.target.value)}
          />
          <PromptInputFooter>
            <PromptInputActions>
              <Button variant="primary" size="icon" disabled={!value.trim()}>Send</Button>
            </PromptInputActions>
            <PromptInputCharCount count={value.length} max={1000} />
          </PromptInputFooter>
        </PromptInput>
      )
    }
    ```
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem label="Angular">

    @Component({

        <snx-prompt-input>
          <snx-prompt-input-textarea placeholder="Ask me anything..." />
          <snx-prompt-input-footer>
            <snx-prompt-input-actions>
              <button class="snx-btn snx-btn-primary snx-btn-icon">Send</button>
            </snx-prompt-input-actions>
            <snx-prompt-input-char-count [count]="0" [max]="1000" />
          </snx-prompt-input-footer>
        </snx-prompt-input>
      `,
    })
    export class PromptDemoComponent {}

## Usage

```tsx
import {
  PromptInput, PromptInputTextarea, PromptInputFooter,
  PromptInputActions, PromptInputCharCount,
} from '@snuxt-ui/react'
```

### Basic

```tsx
<PromptInput>
  <PromptInputTextarea placeholder="Type a message..." />
  <PromptInputFooter>
    <PromptInputActions>
      <Button variant="primary" size="icon">Send</Button>
    </PromptInputActions>
    <PromptInputCharCount count={0} max={500} />
  </PromptInputFooter>
</PromptInput>
```

### With Attachments

```tsx
<PromptInput>
  <PromptInputAttachments>
    <PromptInputAttachment onRemove={() => {}}>file.pdf</PromptInputAttachment>
  </PromptInputAttachments>
  <PromptInputTextarea placeholder="Ask about the file..." />
  <PromptInputFooter>
    <PromptInputActions>
      <Button variant="ghost" size="icon">Attach</Button>
      <Button variant="primary" size="icon">Send</Button>
    </PromptInputActions>
  </PromptInputFooter>
</PromptInput>
```

          <SuggestionChip>Give an example</SuggestionChip>
          <SuggestionChip variant="primary">React patterns</SuggestionChip>
          <SuggestionChip variant="outline">Show code</SuggestionChip>
        </SuggestionChips>
      )
    }

  <TabItem label="Manual (Angular)">
    Copy these files into your project:

  </TabItem>

## Usage

```tsx
import { SuggestionChips, SuggestionChip } from '@snuxt-ui/react'
```

### Variants

```tsx
<SuggestionChips>
  <SuggestionChip variant="default">Default</SuggestionChip>
  <SuggestionChip variant="primary">Primary</SuggestionChip>
  <SuggestionChip variant="outline">Outline</SuggestionChip>
</SuggestionChips>
```

### With Click Handler

```tsx
<SuggestionChips>
  <SuggestionChip onClick={() => send('Tell me more')}>
    Tell me more
  </SuggestionChip>
</SuggestionChips>
```
